# About Spark Social Science {-}

The Spark Social Science is an endeavor by the [Urban Institute](http://www.urban.org/) to expand access and understanding of modern big data capabilities to social scientists and public policy reseachers.

There are four GitHub repositories associated with this project:
* [Spark Social Science](https://github.com/UrbanInstitute/spark-social-science) -- will walk you through the technical process of launching Spark in Amazon Web Services.
* [SparkR-Tutorials](https://github.com/UrbanInstitute/sparkr-tutorials) -- contains a comprehensive introduction to working with Spark using R.
* [PySpark-Tutorials](https://github.com/UrbanInstitute/pyspark-tutorials) -- contains a comprehensive introdution to working with Spark using Python
* [Spark Social Science Manual](https://github.com/UrbanInstitute/spark-social-science-manual) -- the GitHub Repository for this book.

This work is generously funded by the [Alfred P. Sloan Foundation](https://www.sloan.org).
